did.abstract: This is a small collection of materials concerning the St. Xavier College, College of Law. Materials include newspaper clippings, correspondence, and some reports.

bioghist.head: History of St. Xavier College, College of Law
bioghist.p: St. Xavier College opened a College of Law for the Fall Semester of 1919. It was coeducational and was Xavier's first professional school. The College was located in downtown Cincinnati at the St. Xavier High School building. The College was terminated by President Hugo Sloctemyer, S.J. in 1934. St. Xavier College became Xavier University in 1930.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This small collection includes newspaper clippings, correspondence, and some statistical reports.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Course catalogs for various years of the St. Xavier College of Law have been digitized and are available from the library's institutional repository.
